sentences.sContent: After several years of Republican government, the pendulum will undoubtedly swing back and voters will elect a Democrat.
sentences.sCn: 由共和党执政数年后，选民无疑会掉过头来，选出一位民主党人。

sentences.sContent: ...The pendulum swung from much too much government there to much too little here...
...the pendulum hasn't swung back the same way...

trans.tranCn: 摆， 钟摆； 摇摆不定的事态
trans.tranOther: a long metal stick with a weight at the bottom that swings regularly from side to side to control the working of a clock
